lead_paragraph: Marion Jones’s relay teammates will get a chance to argue their case for keeping their Olympic medals, and the Greek sprinter Katerina Thanou will have to wait a few more months to learn whether she will get the gold that Jones won in the 100 meters. The International Olympic Committee said yesterday it would delay a decision on the reallocation of Jones’s five medals — three gold and two bronze — from the 2000 Sydney Games. In October, Jones admitted in federal court that she started using steroids before the Olympics. She has returned the medals.
